page.title: 18GOING TO CHURCH IN TICKHILL
page.content: The predominant{religion}in Tickhill is Christianity.Christians believe that Jesus was Gods son born of Virgin Mary almost 2000 years ago.The 2 main {festivals}are{Christmas}and{Easter. The Christingle raises money for underprivileged children.Children from Tickhill collect money.They receive an orange with a red ribbon, a candle and some nuts which represent the world,Jesus blood,the light and fruit of the world.On Christmas Eve there is a carol service at the Buttercross,a nativity play by children and a Midnight Mass where bells are rung and carols sung.During Easter week there are lots of special services as on{ Good Friday when Jesus was crucified. The climax is on Easter Sunday when Christ is supposed to have risen from the dead.Pathfinders meet on Sundays, sing songs and study the bible.
